definition: Western learning (intellectual movement in the late Qing)/also called 洋務運動|洋务运动
west
the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish
to learn/to study/to imitate/science/-ology

sentences.english: Helin, with a positive attitude welcomes the European and American are welcome to Western from the east.
sentences.chinese: 贺麟以积极的心态欢迎欧风美雨，欢迎西学东来。

sentences.english: Besides, he directed full attention to the training of people with Western learning.
sentences.chinese: 除了兴办近代工业外，容闳还十分注重培养西学人才。

sentences.english: The birth of modern biography literature in China is closely related to the introduction of western thoughts and the re-evaluation of Chinese tradition.
sentences.chinese: 现代传记文学是在西学东渐审视传统的基础上诞生的。

sentences.english: What language is little Susie acquiring?
sentences.chinese: 小苏西学到了什么语言？

sentences.english: The historical background of Chinese literary theory is the introduction of Western modernity into China in the last few decades of the 20th century.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪晚期中国文论的历史背景是现代性西学东渐。

sentences.english: Since the time of the West learning landing the East, Chinese learning has been confronted with the crisis of legitimacy.
sentences.chinese: 西学东渐以来，中国学术始终面临着合法性危机。

sentences.english: All his social practices had something to do with his knowledge and quest for the western learning.
sentences.chinese: 穆藕初的所有社会实践都与对西学的认识和探索有关。

definition: old learning/Chinese traditional teaching as opposed to material from the West
sinology/Chinese studies (in foreign schools)/Han Learning, a Qing dynasty movement aiming at a philological appraisal of the Classics
Confucianism
study of the Confucian classics
Yan Fu (1853-1921), influential Chinese writer and translator of Western books, esp. on social sciences
Western learning
historiography
foreign affairs (in Qing times)/foreign learning
Former Han dynasty school of Confucian scholars
the teaching of Confucius and Mencius
Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
Teaching of Confucius/Confucianism
statecraft
to interpret and make glossaries and commentaries on classic texts
the New Culture Movement (mid-1910s and 1920s), intellectual revolution against Confucianism aiming to introduce Western elements, especially democracy and science

Six Classics, namely: Book of Songs 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1], Book of History 尚書|尚书[Shang4 shu1], Book of Rites 儀禮|仪礼[Yi2 li3], the lost Book of Music 樂經|乐经[Yue4 jing1], Book of Changes 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], Spring and Autumn Annals 春秋[Chun1 qiu1]
